page.title: 02Hospitals in Dumfries 1985
page.content: The hospital service for (150,000) people who live in Dumfries and Galloway, is centred in Dumfries. There are also small hospitals in :-Stranraer, Newtown, Stewart, Kirkcudbright, Castle Douglas, Thornhill, Moffat and Langholm. In{Cresswell Maternity}about 1,500 babies are born every year -90% of the babies in the region.The{Royal {Infirmary}on the Bankend Road has 424 beds. There is also the{Crichton Royal where psychiatrists treat people with mental illness. The mentally handicapped stay there if their relatives can't look after them. If anyone has an accident you phone 999 for an ambulance and it will take them straight to the Emergency Department at the Dumfries and Galloway Royal Infirmary.
